{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Admin Officer",
  "description": "Resource Intermediaries Limited is a distinguished HR Outsourcing and Consulting firm, specializing in customized recruitment solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of companies. Our proficiency extends across a wide spectrum of positions, ranging from top-tier executives to entry-level positions, covering technical, contractual, semi-skilled, and unskilled roles. Additionally, we are recognized experts in providing a range of services including Fumigation Services, Janitorial Services, Payroll Administration, Expatriate Management, Manpower Planning, Executive Training, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajao Estate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry:&nbsp;Administration / Non-Profit (Church Environment)

Job Summary


	The Admin Officer provides essential administrative support to ensure smooth operations within a church environment.
	The role demands strong communication, planning, and coordination skills, with a receptive and adaptable attitude.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform day-to-day administrative duties to ensure smooth operations.
	Support record-keeping, correspondence, and scheduling.
	Assist in coordinating meetings, events, and logistics.
	Provide general administrative support to leadership and members.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an NCE/OND in a relevant discipline.
	Minimum of 1-year of administrative experience.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Strong planning ability and willingness to learn.
	Residency in Ajao Estate, Mafoluku, Ejigbo, or Isolo&nbsp;(mandatory).


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.",

Admin Officer Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited




        
    

        
        Resource Intermediaries Limited is a distinguished HR Outsourcing and Consulting firm, specializing in customized recruitment solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of companies. Our proficiency extends across a wide spectrum of positions, ranging from top-tier executives to entry-level positions, covering technical, contractual, semi-skilled, and unskilled roles. Additionally, we are recognized experts in providing a range of services including Fumigation Services, Janitorial Services, Payroll Administration, Expatriate Management, Manpower Planning, Executive Training, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Ajao Estate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Administration / Non-Profit (Church Environment)

Job Summary


	The Admin Officer provides essential administrative support to ensure smooth operations within a church environment.
	The role demands strong communication, planning, and coordination skills, with a receptive and adaptable attitude.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform day-to-day administrative duties to ensure smooth operations.
	Support record-keeping, correspondence, and scheduling.
	Assist in coordinating meetings, events, and logistics.
	Provide general administrative support to leadership and members.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an NCE/OND in a relevant discipline.
	Minimum of 1-year of administrative experience.
	Excellent communication and organizational skills.
	Strong planning ability and willingness to learn.
	Residency in Ajao Estate, Mafoluku, Ejigbo, or Isolo (mandatory).


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "Lily Hospitals Limited established since 1986 remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Details


	We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Cashier.
	The ideal candidate should possess excellent organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities


	Post customer payments by recording cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions on the accounting software.
	Maintain a comprehensive record of all cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions for future reference.
	Manage an accurate and up-to-date hospital income record by handling bank cheques and documenting relevant transactions.
	Ensure proper documentation of handovers of cash, cheques, and POS printouts.
	Prepare regular (weekly) cash flow reports for management review when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all patients&#39; and hospital&#39;s financial information.
	Manage petty cash and disbursements.
	Issue receipts to patients for services rendered by the organization.
	Lodge cash and cheques into corporate accounts as needed.
	Safely keep custody of cash and cheques received until bank lodgment.
	Ensure the good working condition of POS, cash safe, and other relevant tools used for the role.


Requirements


	Minimum academic qualification of an HND/BSc in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or any related field.
	Minimum of 1-year of relevant work experience.
	Excellent customer service skills.
	Working knowledge of accounting and financial concepts and practices.
	Full working knowledge of the Microsoft Office package, especially with spreadsheet software (Excel).
	Excellent communication and people management skills.
	Must reside in Warri, Delta State or its environs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Credentials to:&nbsp;recruitment@lilyhospitals.net&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Lily hospitals"
    
  },

    }

  },

}



Cashier Job at Lily Hospitals Limited




        
    

        
        Lily Hospitals Limited established since 1986 remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Details
     

            
    




	We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Cashier.
	The ideal candidate should possess excellent organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities


	Post customer payments by recording cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions on the accounting software.
	Maintain a comprehensive record of all cash, cheque, and credit/debit card transactions for future reference.
	Manage an accurate and up-to-date hospital income record by handling bank cheques and documenting relevant transactions.
	Ensure proper documentation of handovers of cash, cheques, and POS printouts.
	Prepare regular (weekly) cash flow reports for management review when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all patients' and hospital's financial information.
	Manage petty cash and disbursements.
	Issue receipts to patients for services rendered by the organization.
	Lodge cash and cheques into corporate accounts as needed.
	Safely keep custody of cash and cheques received until bank lodgment.
	Ensure the good working condition of POS, cash safe, and other relevant tools used for the role.


Requirements


	Minimum academic qualification of an HND/BSc in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or any related field.
	Minimum of 1-year of relevant work experience.
	Excellent customer service skills.
	Working knowledge of accounting and financial concepts and practices.
	Full working knowledge of the Microsoft Office package, especially with spreadsheet software (Excel).
	Excellent communication and people management skills.
	Must reside in Warri, Delta State or its environs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Credentials to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Officer / Storekeeper",
  "description": "Syx-Brij Nigeria Limited - Our client, Spesa Super Store is Ikorodu&rsquo;s newest one-stop shopping experience, offering groceries, fresh produce, household essentials, bakery items, an eatery, and more &mdash; all under one roof.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer / Storekeeper
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Spesa Super Store is Ikorodu&rsquo;s newest one-stop shopping experience, offering groceries, fresh produce, household essentials, bakery items, an eatery, and more &mdash; all under one roof.
	As we prepare to launch operations, We need energetic Shelf Stockers to keep shelves full and organized, ensuring a smooth shopping experience.


Responsibilities


	Stock and arrange products neatly
	Rotate stock and check expiry dates
	Maintain a clean, organized sales floor
	Report low-stock items.


Requirements


	Minimum SSCE
	Physically fit and able to lift stock
	Attention to detail.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-23",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "syx-brij nigeria limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

Inventory Officer / Storekeeper Job at Syx-Brij Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Syx-Brij Nigeria Limited - Our client, Spesa Super Store is Ikorodu’s newest one-stop shopping experience, offering groceries, fresh produce, household essentials, bakery items, an eatery, and more — all under one roof.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer / Storekeeper
Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Spesa Super Store is Ikorodu’s newest one-stop shopping experience, offering groceries, fresh produce, household essentials, bakery items, an eatery, and more — all under one roof.
	As we prepare to launch operations, We need energetic Shelf Stockers to keep shelves full and organized, ensuring a smooth shopping experience.


Responsibilities


	Stock and arrange products neatly
	Rotate stock and check expiry dates
	Maintain a clean, organized sales floor
	Report low-stock items.


Requirements


	Minimum SSCE
	Physically fit and able to lift stock
	Attention to detail.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Supervisor",
  "description": "Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand&rsquo;s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria&rsquo;s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Requisition ID: 1987
Job :&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
Reports to (Title):&nbsp;Warehouse Manager
Department:&nbsp;Supply Chain Department
Direct Reports:&nbsp;Warehouse Officer

Job Purpose


	To manage the various elements of the supply chain in such a manner that ensures goods and other inventory items are transported, stored and delivered on time and in good condition to the production units, stores and the regional warehouse hubs


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Identify and implement cost saving measures to reduce Food Concepts&rsquo; cost of storing and handling goods/equipment
	Generate and analyze reports at pre-defined and agreed intervals to aid decisions relating to inventory and working capital management
	Ensure accuracy of stock picked for shipment
	Ensure zero stock losses both in Warehouse and in-transit to stores and regional warehouse hubs
	Ensure full monitor adherence to health, safety and environmental guidelines
	Ensuring receipt of goods in line with specifications on purchase orders or as instructed by Supply Chain Division
	Application of appropriate asset management procedures in order to achieve maximum return on assets
	Continuous evaluation of warehouse security and implementation of necessary measures to maintain safety of stock.
	Develop preventative maintenance systems and contingency plans.
	Ensure supervision of picked stock in staging area of the warehouse
	Support in the offloading and loading of stocks in the warehouse
	Participate in cycle counting and monthly stock count activities
	Maintain high standard of housekeeping and hygiene in work area assigned
	Provide regular update on stock position as may be required
	Responsible for&nbsp; monthly stock reconciliation with Central Kitchen, Pie Production Units, Pie Xpress Kiosks and Chicken Republic outlets.


Key Performance Indicators


	Delivery turnaround time
	Quality of stock delivered
	Savings on of goods/services
	Zero stock out in all stores
	Achieved/Exceed agreed target


Requirements
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of University Degree/OND/HND


Professional Requirements:


	Membership of the CIPS, CILS, CILCS, CISCOM, Lean Six Sigma or any other related professional qualification is an additional advantage


Experience Requirements:


	Minimum of 3-4 year of working experience


Knowledge Requirements:


	Knowledge of various ERP &ndash; Oracle, Micros etc.
	Office productivity software programs such as word processing, databases, spreadsheet programs, and communications software.


Decision Expectations


	Negotiate competitive quote on logistics cost
	Maintain inventory control and management
	Performs continuous evaluation of warehouse security
	Implements safety measures to ensure safety of stock


Working Conditions:


	Jobholder typically work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, although some roles may involve weekend or evening work.
	This role is both office and field(warehouse) based and has some occasional physical demands such as lifting stock items that weigh over 10kg if the need arises and walking round the warehouse to ensure the effective monitoring.

Warehouse Supervisor Job at Food Concepts Plc




        
    

        
        Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand’s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria’s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Requisition ID: 1987
Job : Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
Reports to (Title): Warehouse Manager
Department: Supply Chain Department
Direct Reports: Warehouse Officer

Job Purpose


	To manage the various elements of the supply chain in such a manner that ensures goods and other inventory items are transported, stored and delivered on time and in good condition to the production units, stores and the regional warehouse hubs


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Identify and implement cost saving measures to reduce Food Concepts’ cost of storing and handling goods/equipment
	Generate and analyze reports at pre-defined and agreed intervals to aid decisions relating to inventory and working capital management
	Ensure accuracy of stock picked for shipment
	Ensure zero stock losses both in Warehouse and in-transit to stores and regional warehouse hubs
	Ensure full monitor adherence to health, safety and environmental guidelines
	Ensuring receipt of goods in line with specifications on purchase orders or as instructed by Supply Chain Division
	Application of appropriate asset management procedures in order to achieve maximum return on assets
	Continuous evaluation of warehouse security and implementation of necessary measures to maintain safety of stock.
	Develop preventative maintenance systems and contingency plans.
	Ensure supervision of picked stock in staging area of the warehouse
	Support in the offloading and loading of stocks in the warehouse
	Participate in cycle counting and monthly stock count activities
	Maintain high standard of housekeeping and hygiene in work area assigned
	Provide regular update on stock position as may be required
	Responsible for  monthly stock reconciliation with Central Kitchen, Pie Production Units, Pie Xpress Kiosks and Chicken Republic outlets.


Key Performance Indicators


	Delivery turnaround time
	Quality of stock delivered
	Savings on of goods/services
	Zero stock out in all stores
	Achieved/Exceed agreed target


Requirements
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of University Degree/OND/HND


Professional Requirements:


	Membership of the CIPS, CILS, CILCS, CISCOM, Lean Six Sigma or any other related professional qualification is an additional advantage


Experience Requirements:


	Minimum of 3-4 year of working experience


Knowledge Requirements:


	Knowledge of various ERP – Oracle, Micros etc.
	Office productivity software programs such as word processing, databases, spreadsheet programs, and communications software.


Decision Expectations


	Negotiate competitive quote on logistics cost
	Maintain inventory control and management
	Performs continuous evaluation of warehouse security
	Implements safety measures to ensure safety of stock


Working Conditions:


	Jobholder typically work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, although some roles may involve weekend or evening work.
	This role is both office and field(warehouse) based and has some occasional physical demands such as lifting stock items that weigh over 10kg if the need arises and walking round the warehouse to ensure the effective monitoring.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst",
  "description": "Terra Aqua Environmental Consultancy Limited - We are a Metal Recycling Plant a prominent player in the recycling industry. Specializing in the conversion of aluminum scraps and Used Beverage Cans (UBC) into high-quality aluminum ingots, our plant initially boasted a production capacity of 1200MT per month. Driven by a commitment to innovation and sustainability, we expanded our operations with a state-of-the-art facility with an installed capacity of 8,600MT of aluminium alloy ingots per month. This expansion underscores our dedication to addressing both environmental challenges and market demands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Sango - Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role


	The Data Analyst will play a critical role in supporting Terra Aqua Environmental Consultancy Limited&rsquo;s Metal Recycling Plant operations by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting production, maintenance, financial, and supply chain data.
	The role is responsible for transforming raw operational data into actionable insights that drive efficiency, sustainability, compliance, and profitability.
	The analyst will work closely with Operations, Maintenance, ESG, Finance, and Senior Management to design reporting systems, build dashboards, and provide decision-support analyses.
	This is an experienced-level position requiring a strong background in industrial/manufacturing data analytics, proven ability to design and maintain databases/dashboards, and the ability to work with large, complex datasets.


Key Responsibilities
Data Management &amp; Reporting:


	Design, implement, and maintain databases for production, equipment, maintenance, and other operational data.
	Ensure accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of daily data capture (production logs, equipment performance, maintenance logs, energy use).
	Develop and maintain real-time dashboards and reports in tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Airtable.
	Establish and enforce data governance standards across departments.


Production &amp; Process Analytics:


	Analyze furnace-level data (inputs, hot ingots, recovery %, capacity utilization) to identify efficiency trends, bottlenecks, and anomalies.
	Monitor scrap feedstock quality, yield, and recovery efficiency to recommend process improvements.
	Provide variance analysis between planned vs actual production and recommend corrective actions.


Maintenance &amp; Asset Analytics:


	Track downtime, repair costs, spare parts usage, and preventive maintenance schedules.
	Support predictive maintenance by analyzing breakdown history and usage trends.
	Provide cost-per-equipment and lifecycle insights to support replacement vs repair decisions.


Financial &amp; Business Analytics:


	Collaborate with Finance to monitor unit cost of production, repair costs, and margins.
	Build cost models for scrap procurement, energy usage, and logistics.
	Provide management with profitability and efficiency dashboards.


Stakeholder Communication &amp; Decision Support:


	Present insights in clear, business-friendly reports and presentations for management and board meetings.
	Support regulators and investors with accurate, auditable data.
	Train operations staff on data capture tools and dashboard usage.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the Role


	Accuracy and completeness of daily production and maintenance data.
	Number and quality of dashboards/reports automated.
	Reduction in downtime through predictive analytics insights.
	Improvement in production yield/recovery through data-driven recommendations.
	Management satisfaction with data quality and insights.


Requirements
Educational Qualification


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Industrial/Production Management, or related field.
	Master&rsquo;s&nbsp;Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, or related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum 4&ndash;6 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst in manufacturing, heavy industry, recycling, or related environment.
	Demonstrated track record in designing dashboards, building data pipelines, and conducting in- depth operational analytics.
	Experience with production process data preferred.


Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency in data visualization &amp; reporting tools: Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
	Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, power query, VBA).
	Proficiency with databases and SQL for managing large datasets.
	Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics and automation will be an advantage.
	Familiarity with ERP systems and integration of operational data.
	Knowledge of predictive analytics for maintenance (machine learning preferred but not required).


Industry Knowledge:


	Understanding of industrial production processes, furnaces, recycling, or heavy equipment operations will be an advantage.
	Familiarity with supply chain and logistics analytics in a manufacturing context.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	High attention to detail and data accuracy.
	Ability to work cross-functionally with operations, maintenance, finance, and ESG teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrterra2024@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

Data Analyst Job at Terra Aqua Environmental Consultancy Limited




        
    

        
        Terra Aqua Environmental Consultancy Limited - We are a Metal Recycling Plant a prominent player in the recycling industry. Specializing in the conversion of aluminum scraps and Used Beverage Cans (UBC) into high-quality aluminum ingots, our plant initially boasted a production capacity of 1200MT per month. Driven by a commitment to innovation and sustainability, we expanded our operations with a state-of-the-art facility with an installed capacity of 8,600MT of aluminium alloy ingots per month. This expansion underscores our dedication to addressing both environmental challenges and market demands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst
     

            
    



Job Location: Sango - Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Role


	The Data Analyst will play a critical role in supporting Terra Aqua Environmental Consultancy Limited’s Metal Recycling Plant operations by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting production, maintenance, financial, and supply chain data.
	The role is responsible for transforming raw operational data into actionable insights that drive efficiency, sustainability, compliance, and profitability.
	The analyst will work closely with Operations, Maintenance, ESG, Finance, and Senior Management to design reporting systems, build dashboards, and provide decision-support analyses.
	This is an experienced-level position requiring a strong background in industrial/manufacturing data analytics, proven ability to design and maintain databases/dashboards, and the ability to work with large, complex datasets.


Key Responsibilities
Data Management & Reporting:


	Design, implement, and maintain databases for production, equipment, maintenance, and other operational data.
	Ensure accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of daily data capture (production logs, equipment performance, maintenance logs, energy use).
	Develop and maintain real-time dashboards and reports in tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Airtable.
	Establish and enforce data governance standards across departments.


Production & Process Analytics:


	Analyze furnace-level data (inputs, hot ingots, recovery %, capacity utilization) to identify efficiency trends, bottlenecks, and anomalies.
	Monitor scrap feedstock quality, yield, and recovery efficiency to recommend process improvements.
	Provide variance analysis between planned vs actual production and recommend corrective actions.


Maintenance & Asset Analytics:


	Track downtime, repair costs, spare parts usage, and preventive maintenance schedules.
	Support predictive maintenance by analyzing breakdown history and usage trends.
	Provide cost-per-equipment and lifecycle insights to support replacement vs repair decisions.


Financial & Business Analytics:


	Collaborate with Finance to monitor unit cost of production, repair costs, and margins.
	Build cost models for scrap procurement, energy usage, and logistics.
	Provide management with profitability and efficiency dashboards.


Stakeholder Communication & Decision Support:


	Present insights in clear, business-friendly reports and presentations for management and board meetings.
	Support regulators and investors with accurate, auditable data.
	Train operations staff on data capture tools and dashboard usage.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the Role


	Accuracy and completeness of daily production and maintenance data.
	Number and quality of dashboards/reports automated.
	Reduction in downtime through predictive analytics insights.
	Improvement in production yield/recovery through data-driven recommendations.
	Management satisfaction with data quality and insights.


Requirements
Educational Qualification


	Bachelor’s Degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Industrial/Production Management, or related field.
	Master’s Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, or related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum 4–6 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst in manufacturing, heavy industry, recycling, or related environment.
	Demonstrated track record in designing dashboards, building data pipelines, and conducting in- depth operational analytics.
	Experience with production process data preferred.


Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency in data visualization & reporting tools: Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
	Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, power query, VBA).
	Proficiency with databases and SQL for managing large datasets.
	Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics and automation will be an advantage.
	Familiarity with ERP systems and integration of operational data.
	Knowledge of predictive analytics for maintenance (machine learning preferred but not required).


Industry Knowledge:


	Understanding of industrial production processes, furnaces, recycling, or heavy equipment operations will be an advantage.
	Familiarity with supply chain and logistics analytics in a manufacturing context.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	High attention to detail and data accuracy.
	Ability to work cross-functionally with operations, maintenance, finance, and ESG teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrterra2024@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
